website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Smart WiFi Router's next-gen hardware doesn't translate to next-gen throughput and range.
cons: Dropped Internet connection once during testing
Antenna labels are difficult to read

customer_reviews.title: ... positive advertising is absolute rubbish with some of the worst WIFI coverage I have ever experienced)
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a BT Home Hub 5 (which despite some very positive advertising is absolute rubbish with some of the worst WIFI coverage I have ever experienced). This bad boy has removed the requirement in my house for 1x BT WiFi extender and 1x Powerline unit. Bits I don't like - FTP - if you have historically used this feature and intend to use it on this router, please note you can't create additional users or set folder security with any level of granularity. The Mrs says its ugly - I guess it is a bit "brutish" - but don't be expecting to hang it on the wall in the front room.
customer_reviews.author: T.FM

customer_reviews.title: Vastly improved wi-fi performance in crowded signal environment
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it 24 hours so this maybe premature but it seems to be a vast improvement over my previous routers. I live in a crowed London router environment and speeds have been getting steadily worse over the last year. The move to the ac standard seems to have helped and I'm now getting speeds that match the wired performance on 5G. It's a big old router but has a pleasing businesslike design and more importantly seems to deliver great results. It's also a little cheaper than some of the other brands with similar spec.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Supe Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Having just upgraded to BT Infinity 2, i bought this device to replace the home hub 5 delivered by BT. The Netgear provides excellent wi-fi over the whole house and with ac enabled devices such as iPad pro etc, delivers line speed connectivity (70+ Mbps). It's easy to configure and I like the management interface. It is an excellent replacement for the home hub 5 which delivered very poor wi-fi performance :( I recommend the Netgear R7500
customer_reviews.author: johnd

customer_reviews.title: Router good, after trial and error. Instructions, Hrmph!
customer_reviews.text: This router was almost easy to set up. I spent about three days trying to get it working wirelessly. Then my daughter asked a neighbour for help. He pressed the Reset button... and it's been working ever since. (There were initially some frequent WiFi interruptions, but they seem to have sorted themselves out.) The instruction booklet should have been written by a professional technical writer... and should have been properly tested. One is rather left hanging in some places. But the unit, when properly set up, works well.
customer_reviews.author: I. A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Totally disappointing in its supposed range. The router is in our small third bedroom (used as my mac computer and printer room). It coul not even extend its range to our downstairs conservatory in our small s/d house. I therefore re-installed my old Asus N66 which does reach the conservatory and is far less ostentatiously intrusive in its size and form. An expensive failed attempt to achieve universal home and garden coverage without resorting to my 2 in tandem Asus range extenders. I really ought to send it back but too late now to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Richard Pressland

customer_reviews.title: This is one hell of a router. I utilise ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one hell of a router. I utilise both bands on my house across all the many devices connected to it. I used to only get around 2-3mbps in my bedroom and now I get anywhere from 16-22! A massive improvement and one that I was very sceptical about before. the only downside I have about this is that I was expecting much further range. Maybe I was expecting too much but I only usually get about 2 bars in my bedroom and it really isn't all the far away. Still, a massive improvement on the previous system and I am over the moon about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nsearle97

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most useful all rounder on the market. Rock Solid, never rebooted in months of use. 4 x gigabit sockets. Smart connection to your internet. Should last you for years to come. wifi strength is excellent. I have it in the loft and get good signal all over house, garden and office.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Conway

customer_reviews.title: Perfect household wi-fi transmitter.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, easily configurable router/transmitter - note that it doesn't include a cable or telephone modem itself, and must be connected to a (preferably hi-speed!) phone or cable modem to receive an internet signal coming into your building. Delivers all-round long-reach dual-band pervasive signal with great security.
customer_reviews.author: fivefooteight

customer_reviews.title: only managing up to 50% of my bandwidth over gigabit ethernet.
customer_reviews.text: Having an awful time with this router, download speeds are terrible even over gigabit ethernet, please see review by "DATA GHOST" as my experience is very much in line with his. Considering returning this product or repurposing it, by switching it to AP mode and using a different router as main router. Will adjust star rating should things improve.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Shilham

customer_reviews.title: Wireless was ATROCIOUS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my BT infinity hub as the wireless range and quality on them is terrible. Whilst the wired connections were fine, the wireless was ATROCIOUS! Some of the laptops could not even pick up any of the 2 signals it transmits, and when connecting the xbox to it, connectivity was so bad I had to disconnect it. I had it replaced with a second one, and again same problems. I already have the R7000 at work and that is perfectly fine, so might just buy that one.
customer_reviews.author: Shabz

customer_reviews.title: Very poor router!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very expensive purchase, it has caused endless problems failing to update the firmware. It doesn't do what it said it would do and the coverage is third rate. Netgear officially no longer offer any customer service. They never did anyway, they were basically unhelpful and tried to sting you for more cash to to answer even basic questions. I have bought many Netgear items over the years but I am now utterly disgusted with them. Do not buy under any circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: DPC

customer_reviews.title: ... with most modern tech but all in all a great router. So many cool features like load balancing/Dynamic ...
customer_reviews.text: Occasionally have to restart (once a fortnight or so) as with most modern tech but all in all a great router. So many cool features like load balancing/Dynamic QOS and parental controls (uses OpenDNS).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Soane

customer_reviews.title: Since we got this router about 4 months ago we've not had to reboot it once and its performance and range have been excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this several months ago as a replacement for a BT Infinity router. The BT router had become flaky, we were having to reboot it virtually every day. Since we got this router about 4 months ago we've not had to reboot it once and its performance and range have been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL MURRAY

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit big
customer_reviews.text: Good, but a bit big. When I say big I mean, 'point those four antennas downwards and use it as a dining room table' big. But the signal does reach parts of the house that the previous modem never did, with a good strong signal everywhere now. But blimey it's big.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit. dual band for the wifi operating at the same time means better access to those with 5G on tabs and phones..I have it sat in my office against a wall surrounded by phones and printers and signal is still great 2 floors above.. About time these things got better range.. and this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Maggotdrowner

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Replaced my Virgin SuperHub with this. So ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast. Replaced my Virgin SuperHub with this. So fast, I bought another one to use as a bridge to my study upstairs. Make sure you update the firmware when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very good high quality product which provides very good interactive features
customer_reviews.text: Very good high quality product which provides very good interactive features. The setting you can change make the whole service worthwhile and the money for the product makes a lot of sense. BT infinity users must use a BT open reach modem in conjunction with this product. A BT home hub will NOT work as it is not a modem that allows other routers to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Tommo

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing, high quality, software is seriously lacking.
customer_reviews.text: The router itself looks fantastic and it works a treat. I get fantastic signal and it suits my purposes. The software however could do with an upgrade as its standard does not match the quality or design of this router.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over Virgin Superhub which is now just working in modem mode
customer_reviews.author: Diduever

customer_reviews.title: A Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a huge beast of a machine. However, it has increased the wifi response round the home. Would have given 5 starts if it had been smaller.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN HOLIDAY

customer_reviews.title: WIFI range not as impressive as advertised. A bit unstable at times
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of kit but the range is nowhere near what they advertise. Also needs a reboot occasionally as the WIFI connection drops. Wired is stable though. Seems to be a feature of Netgear routers these last few years.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Scobie

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR R7500-100UKS R7500 Nighthawk X4 AC2350...
customer_reviews.text: Practical router to replace the standard BT one that wouldn't allow my Cisco VoIP phone to work.
customer_reviews.author: Basil Brush

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it - go Asus instead :-)
customer_reviews.text: Unstable and unreliable. Dislike :( Returned for refund - I bought an Asus RT AC87U and installed Merlin firmware instead. Much better :-)
customer_reviews.author: alexgreyhead

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying. I suggest you look at alternatives
customer_reviews.text: started off well, and then as others have noted after a few weeks the wifi signal drops in and out intermittantly. Very annoying. I suggest you look at alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Goldschmidt

customer_reviews.title: All rounded
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've ever had. Full of features, really fast. Nice way you can plug a HD in it and tranform it in a NAS.
customer_reviews.author: regisbsb

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Junk router. Went back to AC68u as this drops wifi all the time and isn't reliable
customer_reviews.author: downhuman

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Great - all singing all dancing router. Fast, easy to manage and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: J. MCMAHON

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup and works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Using this router as a bridge to another netgear R7500. Very easy to setup and works extremely well. Have had no drop is signal or bandwidth compared with smaller specific bridging connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, provided better wifi coverage in an office environment with up to 20 users.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Portlock

customer_reviews.title: great router - Gives the control and function I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Superb, great router - Gives the control and function I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Solid bit of kit. Very easy to set up. In bridge mode it is the easiest router I have set up. If you tick the access point the ready share will not work. The 2Ghz works fastest.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W P Darell

customer_reviews.title: ... wireless is very quick and the range is much better than my old N router
customer_reviews.text: AC wireless is very quick and the range is much better than my old N router. Can't fault.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Very good and worththe money
customer_reviews.text: Really good experience with this so far - 2g covers the whole house and into the garden 5g gives great performance.
customer_reviews.author: MJ London

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed cannot use by youview box
customer_reviews.text: It works well with bt infinity,but when you need to watch bt sport through the youview box it would not work,you need a bt router for this
customer_reviews.author: anthony michael milburn

customer_reviews.title: ... house with thick wall's and we are getting an excellent signal in every room
customer_reviews.text: We live in a house with thick wall's and we are getting an excellent signal in every room.
customer_reviews.author: tracey brewer

customer_reviews.title: Strong long distance WiFi
customer_reviews.text: If you need a strong long distance WiFi signal for a large house then this will do it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best router I have had to date! Great range, great speeds and reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey's Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Sounds too good to be true..... It is!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router as an upgrade from a R6300. I've had nothing but problems with it to be honest, very close to sending it back and reverting back to the reliable R6300. The Wi-Fi signal keeps dropping out and simple things like changing the access controls take ages to load. Also had issues with the parental controls resetting themselves a number of times, so in all very unreliable. I know its new and I should expect a few issues, but there are just too many to warrant this being a good router. The firmware has been updated 3 times by Netgear but still I have these issues. For a reliable router i'd suggest the R6300, much better...
customer_reviews.author: MJRogers

customer_reviews.title: The router works fine and then
customer_reviews.text: Having serious issues with this router. my wife and two kids all have tablets or mobile devices. The router works fine and then, one of us just cannot connect to the internet. When we check the wireless settings it says we are connected but when you try to go online nothing. The only way to stop this is to switch the router on and off. This is happening daily for no reason and its random who it effects. Seriously annoyed. Think this is going back to Amazon. Waste of time and money, Netgear sorry but switching router's
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. J. Neely

customer_reviews.title: Got BT Infinity?  Do it justice with one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a BT HomeHub 3. What a difference. High speed connection from all over our average-sized newish-build. No signal drops. And while our new "Hive" (British Gas) couldn't talk to the internet via the HomeHub, it work fine with this. Note that if you are an infinity customer you will still need the small white modem box. This is just a router and wireless access point. It is super easy to set up - I am not a technical expert by any means. The "Genie" wizard helps you to set up in only 10 mins or so. Make sure that you do the firmware upgrade during setup.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: The marketing of this product is very good, if only the performance lived up to it
customer_reviews.text: The marketing of this product is very good, if only the performance lived up to it. I had to return mine, as the WiFi range and performance was worse than my 4 year old router. Very disappointed. The set-up was easy as stated, and worked in no time, also the software to manage network is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works ok
customer_reviews.text: Firmware is pretty ropey- most things work ok, but unusual configurations aren't handled well (eg, don't try to use the Guest Network feature if you're using a separate DHCP server). The admin interface is unbelievably slow.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wyer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Lots of connection dropouts and wifi issues with this router. I had hoped firmware updates would fix this but they have not. Buying the asus equivalent instead. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken notice of some of the reviews on amazon which said that the unit I bought (the R7500 model) is not as reliable as the R7000. The unit just seems unstable, dropping connection frequently (although when it does work it's quick). Nether web chat support is friendly and responsive, but they are clearly used to people having problems with the R7500. Changing channels, speed etc. settings hasn't made a fundamental difference to performance, and now I'm 'turning it off and turning it back on again' fairly regularly. It'll soon be time to give up and buy the R7000, thereby chucking £160+ in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: grscholar

customer_reviews.title: Great unless you have Apple products
customer_reviews.text: Great router and awesome wireless performance, however DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE APPLE TV! There is a fundamental (and well publicised) bug which Netgear still have to fix that stops the Aplpe Bonjour system from working, so Apple TV cannot connect to your computer, not can your iPhones, or iPads access anything stored on the PC . . . No sign of a fix in nine months - this product has been sitting on my shelf that long waiting (I am using my older NetGear N900 fine). So this is going in the car boot and I'm getting an Asus RC5300 when it is out.
customer_reviews.author: Celt_UK

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Came the next day. Works a dream. Everything as expected from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: And

customer_reviews.title: Wireless net worse than BT HH5
customer_reviews.text: Wireless net worse than BT HH5, wifi constantly dropped out and could not pick up my repeater, just plugged the HH5 back in and returned this Netgear useless piece of kit back.
customer_reviews.author: bowlesy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just a router, not a wireless router. Ordered in error - my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars110 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
